thread.section_title: Apartment Therapy | Saving the world, one room at a time
thread.title: Target's Presidents Day Sale: Our Picks for the Best Deals
thread.title_full: Target's Presidents Day Sale: Our Picks for the Best Deals

author: Tara Bellucci
title: Target's Presidents Day Sale: Our Picks for the Best Deals
text:
Share 
It's the third Monday in February, and that means in addition to celebrating George Washington's birthday (February 22, 1732, in case you were wondering) with a day off, many a car dealership, mattress store, and big box retailer use the bank holiday to offer a deal. Great news, savvy shoppers: Target's Presidents' Day sale this year is good. And we've rounded up our top finds so you can save time and save money. You're welcome. 
Target is offering up to 30% off home, furniture, patio, and more, plus an additional 10% off when you use code "PRESIDENT". We picked a few categories and scrounged up some great finds in each of them. Happy shopping! Loading Slideshow... Furniture 
We're seeing stylish examples of accent and storage furniture on sale today, so if you need a side table, nightstand, bookcase, or a pretty bar cart, now's your chance. There's also a wide range of dining chairs and bar- and counter-height stools, so if you're in the market for any of those items, be sure to take a deep dive over on Target's site. Loading Slideshow... Bedding 
Whether you like your bedding graphic or textural, there are some lovely duvet sets on sale. Our picks for sheets include linen and a whimsical set with flamingoes, as well as flannel and a heated blanket (it's still winter, after all). Loading Slideshow... Lighting 
We have already waxed poetic about how great Target's lighting game has been lately. Amazing news: most of the uber stylish pieces we featured (and many more!) are now even more affordable. Loading Slideshow... Decor 
Don't need anything major, but want to do a little refresh? There's plenty of inexpensive decor items on sale, like some of our favorite pieces from the latest Oh Joy! collection and Target's cute kids' line, Pillowfort (which looks great in grown up spaces, too).
